intro: Euphrasia randii f. iodantha, commonly known as the iodantha form of the common eyebright, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy, slender stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodland edges and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences. This subspecies is often noted for its medicinal properties, historically used in traditional remedies for eye conditions.
